title: Beautiful Serif typo ID
content:
Recently I came across this typo that I cannot identify. Like a curse it has remained in my mind for months...I look at it, I think of it...I dream of downloading it.

ID anyone?

R.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Chloe.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014160637/http:/typophile.com/files/Chloe.jpg) | 644.4 KB |
author: MATOI Design Lab

comments.content:
There are two typefaces there. [Big Caslon](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014160637/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/big-caslon/) looks like the largest sample, and the top face shown by the woman's picture.

- Mike Yanega

The other typeface looks like [Baskerville Old Face](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014160637/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/baskerville-old-face/).

- Mike Yanega

I just tested the fonts you suggested and both of them are a perfect match...I was hoping for a swift reply to my question but never expected to receive such a precise answer in such a brief time! ( 2.30h ) you have a great eye,

thank you very much, your have help me a lot.

R.

Rodrigo Aguadé  
 [www.mynameisrabo.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014160637/http:/www.mynameisrabo.com/ "www.mynameisrabo.com")
